huffman.tools

Class Compresser

  • java.lang.Object
    • huffman.tools.Compresser

  • public class Compresser
extends java.lang.Object
    A class which compresses a given file using Huffman coding.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Compresser() 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.String[] createCodes(Node node, java.lang.StringBuilder code)
      Traverses the Huffman tree recursively, assigning a binary code to each leaf.
      java.util.PriorityQueue<Node> createLeaves(int[] charFreqs)
      Goes through all 128 characters in the ASCII table, and creates and enqueues a node for every character with a frequency greater than 0.
      void generate(java.io.File inputFile)
      Method in which a compressed file is generated when Huffmans construction algorithm is applied to the input.

      • generate

        public void generate(java.io.File inputFile)
              throws java.io.IOException
        Method in which a compressed file is generated when Huffmans construction algorithm is applied to the input.
        Parameters:
        inputFile - source text file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - file reading failed

      • createLeaves

        public java.util.PriorityQueue<Node> createLeaves(int[] charFreqs)
        Goes through all 128 characters in the ASCII table, and creates and enqueues a node for every character with a frequency greater than 0.
        Parameters:
        charFreqs - table containing frequencies for all 128 ASCII characters
        Returns:
        Min-heap of all leaves

      • createCodes

        public java.lang.String[] createCodes(Node node,
                                      java.lang.StringBuilder code)
        Traverses the Huffman tree recursively, assigning a binary code to each leaf.
        Parameters:
        node - current node
        code - binary code
        Returns:
        a table with a binary code for each character
